{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Corporate Banking Manager",
  "description": "Nomba, launched in 2017 as &quot;Kudi.ai&quot;, is a chatbot that responds to financial requests on social apps. Nomba has since evolved to empower independent businesses to act as neighborhood banks offering basic financial services such as cash withdrawal, transfer and bill payments to all Nigerians, especially those in underserved communities. Today we process more than $500m in payments monthly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Banking Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Corporate Banking Manager to build and manage the Corporate Banking division, mobilize large-corporate deposits and manage the corporate vault/treasury liabilities, ensure risk is well controlled, and drive revenue and margin growth via services for corporations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute corporate banking strategy aimed at growing corporate deposits, operational account balances, escrow/vault holdings, and term liabilities.
	Identify, acquire, and manage relationships with large corporate clients (revenue/turnover thresholds), ensuring high service, cross-selling banking products (cash management, trade finance, treasury services, corporate loans).
	Set up and manage corporate vault services, ensuring robust security, compliance &amp; operational efficiency.
	Oversee credit/risk underwriting for corporate clients; ensure portfolio remains healthy, with acceptable non-performing loan (NPL) levels.
	Lead product innovation in deposit/liability products (fixed deposits, notice accounts, corporate sweep accounts, liquidity products).
	Work with Finance / Treasury to optimize cost of funds, yield on deposits, and liquidity management.
	Manage compliance, KYC/AML, and regulatory reporting for corporate banking.
	Build, coach, and manage a high-performing team of Relationship Managers, Treasury/Deposit Officers, and Credit Analysts.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Corporate Deposits Growth
	Mobilize N40-60B in new corporate deposit liabilities in 12 months
	Average Deposit Tenor / Stability
	Target minimum average tenor of say 90-120 days; reduce deposit churn
	Number of New Corporate Clients&nbsp;e.g. onboard 20+ large corporates with deposit/volume thresholds (&gt; N500M or &gt; N1B).


Skills &amp; Experience


	5-8+ years in corporate banking / commercial banking; Financial House, proven track record in deposit mobilization, treasury or cash management.
	Experience in structuring and managing large corporate vaults/escrow or liquidity products.
	Strong credit risk &amp; underwriting experience.
	Excellent relationship management &amp; negotiation skills; deep network among large enterprises.
	Good understanding of regulatory, compliance, AML/KYC requirements in Nigeria.
	Strong analytical, financial modelling, and forecasting skills.
	Leadership experience: managing teams, coaching, driving performance.


Benefits


	Competitive Monthly base salary of 1.5m - 2m net
	Performance-based commissions and bonuses (% of deposits that stay for a minimum of 90 days)
	Health insurance, pension, and paid time-off benefits
	Learning &amp; development allowance
	Career progression opportunities in a challenging, performance-driven environment.


&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-31",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Nomba"
    
  },

Corporate Banking Manager Job at Nomba




        
    

        
        Nomba, launched in 2017 as "Kudi.ai", is a chatbot that responds to financial requests on social apps. Nomba has since evolved to empower independent businesses to act as neighborhood banks offering basic financial services such as cash withdrawal, transfer and bill payments to all Nigerians, especially those in underserved communities. Today we process more than $500m in payments monthly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Banking Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Corporate Banking Manager to build and manage the Corporate Banking division, mobilize large-corporate deposits and manage the corporate vault/treasury liabilities, ensure risk is well controlled, and drive revenue and margin growth via services for corporations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute corporate banking strategy aimed at growing corporate deposits, operational account balances, escrow/vault holdings, and term liabilities.
	Identify, acquire, and manage relationships with large corporate clients (revenue/turnover thresholds), ensuring high service, cross-selling banking products (cash management, trade finance, treasury services, corporate loans).
	Set up and manage corporate vault services, ensuring robust security, compliance & operational efficiency.
	Oversee credit/risk underwriting for corporate clients; ensure portfolio remains healthy, with acceptable non-performing loan (NPL) levels.
	Lead product innovation in deposit/liability products (fixed deposits, notice accounts, corporate sweep accounts, liquidity products).
	Work with Finance / Treasury to optimize cost of funds, yield on deposits, and liquidity management.
	Manage compliance, KYC/AML, and regulatory reporting for corporate banking.
	Build, coach, and manage a high-performing team of Relationship Managers, Treasury/Deposit Officers, and Credit Analysts.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Corporate Deposits Growth
	Mobilize N40-60B in new corporate deposit liabilities in 12 months
	Average Deposit Tenor / Stability
	Target minimum average tenor of say 90-120 days; reduce deposit churn
	Number of New Corporate Clients e.g. onboard 20+ large corporates with deposit/volume thresholds (> N500M or > N1B).


Skills & Experience


	5-8+ years in corporate banking / commercial banking; Financial House, proven track record in deposit mobilization, treasury or cash management.
	Experience in structuring and managing large corporate vaults/escrow or liquidity products.
	Strong credit risk & underwriting experience.
	Excellent relationship management & negotiation skills; deep network among large enterprises.
	Good understanding of regulatory, compliance, AML/KYC requirements in Nigeria.
	Strong analytical, financial modelling, and forecasting skills.
	Leadership experience: managing teams, coaching, driving performance.


Benefits


	Competitive Monthly base salary of 1.5m - 2m net
	Performance-based commissions and bonuses (% of deposits that stay for a minimum of 90 days)
	Health insurance, pension, and paid time-off benefits
	Learning & development allowance
	Career progression opportunities in a challenging, performance-driven environment.


     

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "Jobvet Services - Our client, a reputable and fast-growing restaurant, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse Zone 4, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the restaurant&rsquo;s online presence, creating engaging content, and driving brand awareness across all social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective social media strategies to boost visibility and engagement.
	Create and schedule high-quality content (photos, videos, captions, and stories) showcasing the restaurant&rsquo;s offerings.
	Manage daily posting and interactions across platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, X, etc.).
	Run targeted ads and campaigns to attract and retain customers.
	Monitor analytics and provide regular performance reports.
	Collaborate with the restaurant and marketing team to align social media with promotions and events.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or Digital Marketer (hospitality experience is an advantage).
	Excellent content creation, copywriting, and storytelling skills.
	Proficiency in social media tools, analytics, and advertising.
	Strong sense of creativity, visual aesthetics, and trend awareness.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 per month.&nbsp;

What We Offer:


	Competitive pay package.
	Accomodation and feeding.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their Applications to:&nbsp;jobvet24@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

}



Social Media Manager Job at Jobvet Services




        
    

        
        Jobvet Services - Our client, a reputable and fast-growing restaurant, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Wuse Zone 4, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the restaurant’s online presence, creating engaging content, and driving brand awareness across all social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement effective social media strategies to boost visibility and engagement.
	Create and schedule high-quality content (photos, videos, captions, and stories) showcasing the restaurant’s offerings.
	Manage daily posting and interactions across platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, X, etc.).
	Run targeted ads and campaigns to attract and retain customers.
	Monitor analytics and provide regular performance reports.
	Collaborate with the restaurant and marketing team to align social media with promotions and events.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or Digital Marketer (hospitality experience is an advantage).
	Excellent content creation, copywriting, and storytelling skills.
	Proficiency in social media tools, analytics, and advertising.
	Strong sense of creativity, visual aesthetics, and trend awareness.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 per month. 

What We Offer:


	Competitive pay package.
	Accomodation and feeding.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: jobvet24@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphics Designer",
  "description": "Forti Foods is a social enterprise at the forefront of innovative food products that prioritise health, nutrition, and sustainability. Our mission is to ensure everyone has access to high-quality, ready-to-eat meals by developing nutritious, delicious, and culturally-inspired solutions tailored to meet diverse needs. Our vision is to foster resilience and dignity through sustainable food innovation, creating lasting social impact that uplifts communities and transforms lives beyond the plate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Description


	Forti Foods is searching for a visual storyteller &mdash; a creative mind who can translate ideas of nourishment, innovation, and impact into powerful, memorable designs.
	As our Graphics Designer, you&rsquo;ll shape how Forti Foods connects with people through visuals that inspire trust, appetite, and emotion, that connect with partners, communities, and consumers across platforms.
	From product packaging to campaign graphics, you&rsquo;ll bring our mission of making nutrition accessible, modern, and meaningful to life &mdash; one design at a time.


Key Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Develop and design visual assets (social media graphics, product visuals, infographics, digital ads, etc.) that align with Forti Foods&rsquo; brand identity and messaging.
	Support the communications and marketing teams with compelling visuals that strengthen brand awareness and engagement.
	Create designs for corporate materials &mdash; including brochures, reports, and presentations.
	Collaborate on campaigns and content initiatives that communicate Forti Foods&rsquo; impact in nutrition, sustainability, and innovation.
	Ensure brand consistency across all digital and print designs.
	Stay updated on design trends and visual storytelling in the food, CSR, and humanitarian sectors.
	Manage multiple design projects, meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications and Skills


	A skilled and imaginative graphics designer with at least 3&ndash;5 years of experience in corporate, creative, or development-related design work.
	Proficient in design and editing tools &mdash; Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) or Canva, and familiar with basic video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere Pro, etc.)
	Strong eye for color, layout, and typography with attention to detail.
	Able to translate complex ideas (nutrition, CSR, impact) into simple, powerful visuals.
	proactive and collaborative creator who can work independently and within a small, dynamic team.
	Passionate about using creativity for social good &mdash; and eager to design with purpose.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Portfolio to:&nbsp;hr@forti-foods.com&nbsp;using &quot;Graphics Designer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Graphics Designer Job at Forti Foods




        
    

        
        Forti Foods is a social enterprise at the forefront of innovative food products that prioritise health, nutrition, and sustainability. Our mission is to ensure everyone has access to high-quality, ready-to-eat meals by developing nutritious, delicious, and culturally-inspired solutions tailored to meet diverse needs. Our vision is to foster resilience and dignity through sustainable food innovation, creating lasting social impact that uplifts communities and transforms lives beyond the plate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Forti Foods is searching for a visual storyteller — a creative mind who can translate ideas of nourishment, innovation, and impact into powerful, memorable designs.
	As our Graphics Designer, you’ll shape how Forti Foods connects with people through visuals that inspire trust, appetite, and emotion, that connect with partners, communities, and consumers across platforms.
	From product packaging to campaign graphics, you’ll bring our mission of making nutrition accessible, modern, and meaningful to life — one design at a time.


Key Responsibilities 


	Develop and design visual assets (social media graphics, product visuals, infographics, digital ads, etc.) that align with Forti Foods’ brand identity and messaging.
	Support the communications and marketing teams with compelling visuals that strengthen brand awareness and engagement.
	Create designs for corporate materials — including brochures, reports, and presentations.
	Collaborate on campaigns and content initiatives that communicate Forti Foods’ impact in nutrition, sustainability, and innovation.
	Ensure brand consistency across all digital and print designs.
	Stay updated on design trends and visual storytelling in the food, CSR, and humanitarian sectors.
	Manage multiple design projects, meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications and Skills


	A skilled and imaginative graphics designer with at least 3–5 years of experience in corporate, creative, or development-related design work.
	Proficient in design and editing tools — Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) or Canva, and familiar with basic video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere Pro, etc.)
	Strong eye for color, layout, and typography with attention to detail.
	Able to translate complex ideas (nutrition, CSR, impact) into simple, powerful visuals.
	proactive and collaborative creator who can work independently and within a small, dynamic team.
	Passionate about using creativity for social good — and eager to design with purpose.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Portfolio to: hr@forti-foods.com using "Graphics Designer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Tilden Development Limited is a development company that specializes in innovative residential hospitality and commercial developments in Lagos. Our aim is to harness investments in the real estate sector and provide our investors with transparency, quality customer satisfaction, and timely service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Position Overview


	The business development manager will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, forging strategic partnerships, driving revenue growth, and expanding our client base across residential, commercial, or tech-enabled real estate segments.


Key Responsibilities (Duties)
Business Growth &amp; Revenue Generation:


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, clients, and partnerships to meet company revenue goals.
	Analyze market trends to develop entry strategies and identify untapped segments (e.g., co-living, smart buildings, real estate developers, facility management firms).


Strategic Partnerships:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders in the real estate ecosystem &mdash; developers, landlords, brokers, tech vendors, and enterprise clients.
	Collaborate with partners to co-develop solutions that integrate with the company&rsquo;s technology offerings (e.g., digital listings, property management tools, rental platforms).


Product &amp; Market Alignment:


	Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to provide market feedback and insights that influence roadmap development and positioning strategies.
	Conduct competitor analysis and customer feedback sessions to improve value proposition and client experience.


Sales Reporting / Record keeping:


	Maintain accurate sales and CRM records, track KPIs, and prepare regular reports for leadership.
	Deliver monthly/quarterly sales targets and growth forecasts.


Cross-functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the Marketing team on lead generation campaigns, events, and brand awareness strategies.
	Collaborate with Legal and Finance teams to structure deals and ensure contractual compliance.
	KSA&rsquo;s (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
	Strong knowledge of B2B sales.
	Strong understanding of the real estate value chain, including leasing, property management, and tech adoption trends.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency with CRM tools and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Academic Qualification (Minimum)


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, Marketing, Real Estate Management, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development, preferably within Property Tech, real estate, or technology startups.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr2@tildenng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Business Development Manager Job at Tilden Development Limited




        
    

        
        Tilden Development Limited is a development company that specializes in innovative residential hospitality and commercial developments in Lagos. Our aim is to harness investments in the real estate sector and provide our investors with transparency, quality customer satisfaction, and timely service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Position Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The business development manager will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, forging strategic partnerships, driving revenue growth, and expanding our client base across residential, commercial, or tech-enabled real estate segments.


Key Responsibilities (Duties)
Business Growth & Revenue Generation:


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, clients, and partnerships to meet company revenue goals.
	Analyze market trends to develop entry strategies and identify untapped segments (e.g., co-living, smart buildings, real estate developers, facility management firms).


Strategic Partnerships:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders in the real estate ecosystem — developers, landlords, brokers, tech vendors, and enterprise clients.
	Collaborate with partners to co-develop solutions that integrate with the company’s technology offerings (e.g., digital listings, property management tools, rental platforms).


Product & Market Alignment:


	Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to provide market feedback and insights that influence roadmap development and positioning strategies.
	Conduct competitor analysis and customer feedback sessions to improve value proposition and client experience.


Sales Reporting / Record keeping:


	Maintain accurate sales and CRM records, track KPIs, and prepare regular reports for leadership.
	Deliver monthly/quarterly sales targets and growth forecasts.


Cross-functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the Marketing team on lead generation campaigns, events, and brand awareness strategies.
	Collaborate with Legal and Finance teams to structure deals and ensure contractual compliance.
	KSA’s (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
	Strong knowledge of B2B sales.
	Strong understanding of the real estate value chain, including leasing, property management, and tech adoption trends.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency with CRM tools and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Academic Qualification (Minimum)


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Real Estate Management, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development, preferably within Property Tech, real estate, or technology startups.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr2@tildenng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Assurance Officer",
  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	Responsible for executing Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC) activities for the assigned discipline at the site, ensuring compliance with established standards and specifications.
	The role also involves providing accurate and reliable analytical support to plant operations through the effective implementation of laboratory procedures and quality standards, contributing to overall operational efficiency and business performance.


Responsibilities


	Inspect received routine and product samples, and promptly communicate any abnormalities or non-receipt of samples to the Shift In-Charge.
	Conduct accurate and reliable tests within defined precision limits, following approved methods and laboratory procedures.
	Ensure strict adherence to standard test methods, work instructions, and quality system procedures.
	Identify and report exceptions or deviations in test results for necessary action.
	Initiate and communicate resampling or retesting requirements as needed.
	Collect special or ad-hoc samples as directed.
	Provide on-the-spot mitigation or corrective actions during emergencies under the guidance of the Section Head.
	Manage product samples effectively, ensuring proper labeling, storage, and traceability.
	Dispose of leftover or expired samples safely, in accordance with laboratory safety and environmental standards.
	Calibrate laboratory instruments and standardize reagents as per defined schedules.
	Ensure full compliance with all quality management system requirements.
	Record and maintain test results accurately and in a timely manner in the raw data sheets or electronic systems.
	Maintain the availability and readiness of analytical equipment, instruments, and glassware through proper cleaning and routine upkeep.
	Uphold high standards of housekeeping and safety within the laboratory environment.
	Follow all applicable HSEF (Health, Safety, Environment, and Fire) procedures and practices.
	Stay informed and comply with environmental, site-specific, statutory, and intellectual property (IP) regulations.
	Handle chemicals, equipment, and tools strictly in accordance with safety norms and best practices.
	Ensure safe working conditions at all times and promptly report unsafe acts or conditions.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Chemistry, Applied Chemistry, or Industrial Chemistry from a recognized institution.
	Experience: Fresh graduates with the above qualification&nbsp;may apply. Prior laboratory or industrial experience will be an added advantage.
",

Quality Assurance Officer Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for executing Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC) activities for the assigned discipline at the site, ensuring compliance with established standards and specifications.
	The role also involves providing accurate and reliable analytical support to plant operations through the effective implementation of laboratory procedures and quality standards, contributing to overall operational efficiency and business performance.


Responsibilities


	Inspect received routine and product samples, and promptly communicate any abnormalities or non-receipt of samples to the Shift In-Charge.
	Conduct accurate and reliable tests within defined precision limits, following approved methods and laboratory procedures.
	Ensure strict adherence to standard test methods, work instructions, and quality system procedures.
	Identify and report exceptions or deviations in test results for necessary action.
	Initiate and communicate resampling or retesting requirements as needed.
	Collect special or ad-hoc samples as directed.
	Provide on-the-spot mitigation or corrective actions during emergencies under the guidance of the Section Head.
	Manage product samples effectively, ensuring proper labeling, storage, and traceability.
	Dispose of leftover or expired samples safely, in accordance with laboratory safety and environmental standards.
	Calibrate laboratory instruments and standardize reagents as per defined schedules.
	Ensure full compliance with all quality management system requirements.
	Record and maintain test results accurately and in a timely manner in the raw data sheets or electronic systems.
	Maintain the availability and readiness of analytical equipment, instruments, and glassware through proper cleaning and routine upkeep.
	Uphold high standards of housekeeping and safety within the laboratory environment.
	Follow all applicable HSEF (Health, Safety, Environment, and Fire) procedures and practices.
	Stay informed and comply with environmental, site-specific, statutory, and intellectual property (IP) regulations.
	Handle chemicals, equipment, and tools strictly in accordance with safety norms and best practices.
	Ensure safe working conditions at all times and promptly report unsafe acts or conditions.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Chemistry, Applied Chemistry, or Industrial Chemistry from a recognized institution.
	Experience: Fresh graduates with the above qualification may apply. Prior laboratory or industrial experience will be an added advantage.
